name: Phyrexian Negator
set_name: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. The Coalition
oracle_text: Trample
Whenever Phyrexian Negator is dealt damage, sacrifice that many permanents.
flavor_text: They exist to cease.

rulings.text: Sacrificing this card does not prevent you from having to make the other sacrifices.

name: Carrion Feeder
set_name: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. The Coalition
oracle_text: Carrion Feeder can't block.
Sacrifice a creature: Put a +1/+1 counter on Carrion Feeder.
flavor_text: Stinking of rot, it leaps between gravestones in search of its next meal.

rulings.text: You can sacrifice Carrion Feeder to activate its own ability. The ability will have no effect as it resolves.

name: Phyrexian Battleflies
set_name: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. The Coalition
oracle_text: Flying
{B}: Phyrexian Battleflies gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability no more than twice each turn.
flavor_text: After encountering them, Squee finally lost his appetite for bugs.

name: Phyrexian Denouncer
set_name: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. The Coalition
oracle_text: {T}, Sacrifice Phyrexian Denouncer: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
flavor_text:
"The first stage of the illness: rash and nausea."
—Phyrexian progress notes

name: Bone Shredder
set_name: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. The Coalition
oracle_text: Flying
Echo {2}{B} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)

set_name: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. The Coalition

rulings.text: You get the mana whether you want it or not. If you don’t spend it, it will disappear at the end of the current step (or phase).

oracle_text: {1}, Sacrifice a creature: Put a +1/+1 counter on Phyrexian Broodlings.

set_name: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. The Coalition
flavor_text:

It doesn't laugh or cry.

Phyrexian Colossus can't be blocked except by three or more creatures.

name: Voltaic Key
set_name: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. The Coalition
oracle_text: {1}, {T}: Untap target artifact.
flavor_text: The key did not work on a single lock, yet it opened many doors.

name: Dark Ritual
set_name: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. The Coalition
oracle_text: Add {B}{B}{B}.
flavor_text:
"From void evolved Phyrexia. Great Yawgmoth, Father of Machines, saw its perfection. Thus the Grand Evolution began."
—Phyrexian Scriptures

name: Lightning Greaves
set_name: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. The Coalition
oracle_text: Equipped creature has haste and shroud. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
Equip {0}
flavor_text: After lightning struck the cliffs, the ore became iron, the iron became steel, and the steel became greaves. The lightning never left.

rulings.text: You are not allowed to “unequip” equipment from a creature. If Lightning Greaves is attached to the only creature you control, you won’t be able to attach other equipment to it (or target it with anything else) until you have another creature onto which you can move Lightning Greaves.

name: Phyrexian Totem
set_name: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. The Coalition
oracle_text: {T}: Add {B}.
{2}{B}: Phyrexian Totem becomes a 5/5 black Horror artifact creature with trample until end of turn.
Whenever Phyrexian Totem is dealt damage, if it's a creature, sacrifice that many permanents.

rulings.text: When damage is dealt to Phyrexian Totem, its triggered ability will trigger. A number of permanents equal to the amount of damage dealt will be sacrificed when the ability resolves. It doesn’t matter if Phyrexian Totem isn’t on the battlefield when the ability resolves, as long as Phyrexian Totem was a creature as it left the battlefield. If one of the permanents sacrificed is Phyrexian Totem itself, the requisite number of other permanents must still be sacrificed.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn’t matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

name: Phyrexian Vault
set_name: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. The Coalition
oracle_text: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Draw a card.
flavor_text:
"The secrets of Phyrexia are expensive. You will pay in brass and bone, steel and sinew."
—Kaervek

name: Puppet Strings
set_name: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. The Coalition
oracle_text: {2}, {T}: You may tap or untap target creature.
flavor_text: "Have no illusions," Volrath warned Greven, "about free will."

name: Whispersilk Cloak
set_name: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. The Coalition
oracle_text: Equipped creature can't be blocked and has shroud. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
Equip {2}
flavor_text: Such cloaks are in high demand both by assassins and by those who fear them.

name: Worn Powerstone
set_name: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. The Coalition
oracle_text: Worn Powerstone enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {C}{C}.
flavor_text: Even a fragment of a powerstone contains within it not just energy, but space—vast dimensions trapped in fragile crystal.

name: Slay
set_name: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. The Coalition
oracle_text: Destroy target green creature. It can't be regenerated.
Draw a card.
flavor_text: The elves had the edge in guile, skill, and valor. But in the end, only sheer numbers mattered.

rulings.text: You don’t draw a card if this spell is countered.

name: Hideous End
set_name: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. The Coalition
oracle_text: Destroy target nonblack creature. Its controller loses 2 life.
flavor_text: Death is a generous author, always willing to grant a stirring final chapter.

rulings.text: If the targeted creature is an illegal target by the time Hideous End resolves, the entire spell doesn’t resolve. No one loses life.

name: Phyrexian Arena
set_name: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. The Coalition
oracle_text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.
flavor_text: An audience of one with the malice of thousands.

name: Hornet Cannon
set_name: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. The Coalition
oracle_text: {3}, {T}: Create a 1/1 colorless Insect artifact creature token with flying and haste named Hornet. Destroy it at the beginning of the next end step.

name: Phyrexian Processor
set_name: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. The Coalition
oracle_text: As Phyrexian Processor enters the battlefield, pay any amount of life.
{4}, {T}: Create an X/X black Minion creature token, where X is the life paid as Phyrexian Processor entered the battlefield.

rulings.text: You can pay 0 life if you want, but it’s not useful most of the time.

name: Tendrils of Corruption
set_name: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. The Coalition
oracle_text: Tendrils of Corruption deals X damage to target creature and you gain X life, where X is the number of Swamps you control.
flavor_text: Darkness doesn't always send its minions to do its dirty work.

rulings.text: The amount of life you gain is equal to the number of Swamps you control, not the amount of damage Tendrils of Corruption deals (in case some of it is prevented).
If the targeted creature is an illegal target by the time Tendrils of Corruption would resolve, the entire spell doesn’t resolve. You won’t gain any life.

name: Living Death
set_name: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. The Coalition
oracle_text: Each player exiles all creature cards from their graveyard, then sacrifices all creatures they control, then puts all cards they exiled this way onto the battlefield.

rulings.text: As Living Death resolves, all players exile their creature cards from graveyards at the same time. Then all players sacrifice all creatures they control at the same time. Then all players put all creatures they exiled onto the battlefield at the same time.

Only cards exiled by Living Death’s first instruction are put onto the battlefield. If a replacement effect (such as that of Leyline of the Void) causes any of the sacrificed creatures to be exiled instead of put into a graveyard, those cards aren’t returned to the battlefield.

set_name: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. The Coalition

name: Urza's Rage
set_name: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. The Coalition
oracle_text: Kicker {8}{R} (You may pay an additional {8}{R} as you cast this spell.)
This spell can't be countered.
Urza's Rage deals 3 damage to any target. If this spell was kicked, instead it deals 10 damage to that permanent or player and the damage can't be prevented.

rulings.text: This spell has a self-replacement in it . This means that if Urza’s Rage is kicked, the 3 damage is replaced with 10 unpreventable damage before any other replacements can be applied. For example, you can’t use Healing Salve to prevent the 3 damage before it gets changed.
You can target this spell with spells and abilities, so you can change its target. Those spells and abilities just can’t counter it.
The damage is unpreventable, but it can be affected by replacement effects.
Counterspells can be cast that target it, but when they resolve they simply don’t counter it since it can’t be countered.

name: Thornscape Apprentice
set_name: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. The Coalition
oracle_text: {R}, {T}: Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.
{W}, {T}: Tap target creature.

name: Nomadic Elf
set_name: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. The Coalition
oracle_text: {1}{G}: Add one mana of any color.
flavor_text: "I've journeyed across Dominaria. Phyrexians are everywhere. Plague is everywhere. There's no place left to hide."

name: Quirion Elves
set_name: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. The Coalition
oracle_text: As Quirion Elves enters the battlefield, choose a color.
{T}: Add {G}.
{T}: Add one mana of the chosen color.

name: Sunscape Battlemage
set_name: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. The Coalition
oracle_text: Kicker {1}{G} and/or {2}{U} (You may pay an additional {1}{G} and/or {2}{U} as you cast this spell.)
When Sunscape Battlemage enters the battlefield, if it was kicked with its {1}{G} kicker, destroy target creature with flying.
When Sunscape Battlemage enters the battlefield, if it was kicked with its {2}{U} kicker, draw two cards.

name: Thunderscape Battlemage
set_name: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. The Coalition
oracle_text: Kicker {1}{B} and/or {G} (You may pay an additional {1}{B} and/or {G} as you cast this spell.)
When Thunderscape Battlemage enters the battlefield, if it was kicked with its {1}{B} kicker, target player discards two cards.
When Thunderscape Battlemage enters the battlefield, if it was kicked with its {G} kicker, destroy target enchantment.

name: Thornscape Battlemage
set_name: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. The Coalition
oracle_text: Kicker {R} and/or {W} (You may pay an additional {R} and/or {W} as you cast this spell.)
When Thornscape Battlemage enters the battlefield, if it was kicked with its {R} kicker, it deals 2 damage to any target.
When Thornscape Battlemage enters the battlefield, if it was kicked with its {W} kicker, destroy target artifact.

rulings.text: You choose whether to kick a spell as you cast it, and you pay that much along with the spell’s mana cost at the same time. Kicking a spell is always optional.
You can pay any particular kicker cost only once. You can’t pay it multiple times to get multiples of either triggered ability.
If Thornscape Battlemage is put onto the battlefield as the result of a spell or ability, there’s no opportunity to kick it.
Kicker costs don’t change a spell’s mana cost or converted mana cost.

name: Verduran Emissary
set_name: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. The Coalition
oracle_text: Kicker {1}{R} (You may pay an additional {1}{R} as you cast this spell.)
When Verduran Emissary enters the battlefield, if it was kicked, destroy target artifact. It can't be regenerated.

name: Yavimaya Elder
set_name: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. The Coalition
oracle_text: When Yavimaya Elder dies, you may search your library for up to two basic land cards, reveal them, put them into your hand, then shuffle your library.
{2}, Sacrifice Yavimaya Elder: Draw a card.

name: Charging Troll
set_name: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. The Coalition
oracle_text: Vigilance
{G}: Regenerate Charging Troll.
flavor_text: They stop for nothing, not even the end of a battle.

name: Gerrard Capashen
set_name: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. The Coalition
oracle_text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you gain 1 life for each card in target opponent's hand.
{3}{W}: Tap target creature. Activate this ability only if Gerrard Capashen is attacking.

name: Darigaaz, the Igniter
set_name: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. The Coalition
oracle_text: Flying

Whenever Darigaaz, the Igniter deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {2}{R}. If you do, choose a color, then that player reveals their hand and Darigaaz deals damage to the player equal to the number of cards of that color revealed this way.

rulings.text: You choose the color during resolution. This means your opponent does not get to react after knowing the color you chose.

name: Rith, the Awakener
set_name: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. The Coalition
oracle_text: Flying
Whenever Rith, the Awakener deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {2}{G}. If you do, choose a color, then create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token for each permanent of that color.

rulings.text: You choose the color during resolution. This means your opponent does not get to react after knowing the color you chose.

name: Treva, the Renewer
set_name: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. The Coalition
oracle_text: Flying
Whenever Treva, the Renewer deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {2}{W}. If you do, choose a color, then you gain 1 life for each permanent of that color.

rulings.text: You choose the color during resolution. This means your opponent does not get to react after knowing the color you chose.

name: Evasive Action
set_name: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. The Coalition
oracle_text: Domain — Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1} for each basic land type among lands you control.
flavor_text: Effective use of terrain is a lesson good commanders learn quickly.

rulings.text: To determine the number of basic land types among lands you control, look at the lands you have on the battlefield and ask yourself whether the subtypes Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest appear within that group. The number of times you say yes (topping out at five) tells you how powerful your domain abilities will be.

How many lands you control of a particular basic land type is irrelevant to a domain ability, as long as that number is greater than zero. As far as domain is concerned, ten Forests is the same as one Forest.

A number of nonbasic lands have basic land types. Domain abilities don’t count the number of lands you control — they count the number of basic land types among lands you control, even if that means checking the same land twice. For example, if you control a Tundra, an Overgrown Tomb, and a Madblind Mountain, you’ll have a Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest among the lands you control. Your domain abilities will be maxed out.

name: Tribal Flames
set_name: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. The Coalition
oracle_text: Domain — Tribal Flames deals X damage to any target, where X is the number of basic land types among lands you control.
flavor_text:
"Fire is the universal language."
—Jhoira, master artificer

rulings.text: To determine the number of basic land types among lands you control, look at the lands you have on the battlefield and ask yourself whether the subtypes Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest appear within that group. The number of times you say yes (topping out at five) tells you how powerful your domain abilities will be.

How many lands you control of a particular basic land type is irrelevant to a domain ability, as long as that number is greater than zero. As far as domain is concerned, ten Forests is the same as one Forest.

A number of nonbasic lands have basic land types. Domain abilities don’t count the number of lands you control — they count the number of basic land types among lands you control, even if that means checking the same land twice. For example, if you control a Tundra, an Overgrown Tomb, and a Madblind Mountain, you’ll have a Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest among the lands you control. Your domain abilities will be maxed out.

name: Fertile Ground
set_name: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. The Coalition
oracle_text: Enchant land
Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds an additional one mana of any color.
flavor_text: As Phyrexians descended, Multani paused to reflect on the beauty that might never be seen again.

name: Gerrard's Command
set_name: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. The Coalition
oracle_text: Untap target creature. It gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
flavor_text: "Unless you like the idea of becoming some goblin's lunch, get up and move!"

rulings.text: This can target a creature which is already untapped.

name: Coalition Relic
set_name: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. The Coalition
oracle_text: {T}: Add one mana of any color.
{T}: Put a charge counter on Coalition Relic.
At the beginning of your precombat main phase, remove all charge counters from Coalition Relic. Add one mana of any color for each charge counter removed this way.

rulings.text: If you remove multiple charge counters from Coalition Relic at once, you may add a different color of mana to your mana pool for each one.
Only the first main phase each turn is considered a precombat main phase, even if other main phases or combat phases are created (with Relentless Assault, for example).

name: Narrow Escape
set_name: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. The Coalition
oracle_text: Return target permanent you control to its owner's hand. You gain 4 life.
flavor_text: He could find no strength left to budge, no power left to fight, no will left to live. Luckily, they could find him.

name: Exotic Curse
set_name: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. The Coalition
oracle_text: Enchant creature
Domain — Enchanted creature gets -1/-1 for each basic land type among lands you control.
flavor_text:
Fouler than a necromancer's kiss.
—Jamuraan expression

rulings.text: To determine the number of basic land types among lands you control, look at the lands you have on the battlefield and ask yourself whether the subtypes Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest appear within that group. The number of times you say yes (topping out at five) tells you how powerful your domain abilities will be.

How many lands you control of a particular basic land type is irrelevant to a domain ability, as long as that number is greater than zero. As far as domain is concerned, ten Forests is the same as one Forest.

A number of nonbasic lands have basic land types. Domain abilities don’t count the number of lands you control — they count the number of basic land types among lands you control, even if that means checking the same land twice. For example, if you control a Tundra, an Overgrown Tomb, and a Madblind Mountain, you’ll have a Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest among the lands you control. Your domain abilities will be maxed out.

name: Harrow
set_name: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. The Coalition
oracle_text: As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a land.
Search your library for up to two basic land cards, put them onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library.
flavor_text: No spot in nature is truly barren.

rulings.text: The sacrifice of a land is part of the cost of casting Harrow. You can’t pay this cost more than once to get a multiple effect.
The two lands do not count toward your normal one land you can play each turn.
Because the “search” requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don’t have to find the card if you don’t want to.

name: Armadillo Cloak
set_name: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. The Coalition
oracle_text: Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has trample.
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage, you gain that much life.
flavor_text: "Don't laugh. It works."

rulings.text: While Armadillo Cloak’s last ability is similar to lifelink, it isn’t lifelink—it’s a normal triggered ability. If a creature you control with lifelink wears an Armadillo Cloak and deals damage, first you’ll gain that much life for lifelink, and then Armadillo Cloak’s triggered ability is put onto the stack. This also means that multiple instances of Armadillo Cloak’s triggered ability do trigger separately.
If Armadillo Cloak enchants a creature you don’t control, you’ll gain life when it deals damage, as long as that damage hasn’t already caused you to lose the game.

name: Darigaaz's Charm
set_name: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. The Coalition
oracle_text: Choose one —
• Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
• Darigaaz's Charm deals 3 damage to any target.
• Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

oracle_text: Domain — Target player draws a card for each basic land type among lands they control.

The number of times you say yes (topping out at five) tells you how powerful your domain abilities will be.
